description: Unique code identifying the standardized asset category used for classification and business rules.
Human-readable description of the asset type for users and reports.
Owning application or workgroup associated with this asset type.
Optional parent type to build an asset type hierarchy; confirm relationships with SME.
Hierarchy depth level for the type (e.g., 0 for root).
Indicates whether this type is classified as equipment.
Indicates whether this type represents facility assets.
Indicates whether this type represents hand tools or small tools.
Indicates whether assets of this type require/support calibration management.
Indicates if asset identifiers are auto-generated for this type.
Pattern or expression used to generate automatic asset identifiers; confirm format with SME.
Configured method used to calculate depreciation for assets of this type.
Standard planning rate (e.g., cost per hour/mile) used for budgeting or scheduling; confirm units with SME.
Default downtime target or expectation for this type; confirm definition and units with SME.
Maximum allowable downtime in hours before escalation or EOL scoring; confirm policy with SME.
Chargeback or external billing rate applied to this type (e.g., per hour/mile).
User or system process that created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last updated the record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the record.
Broad grouping used for reporting and policy (e.g., vehicles, generators).
Reference to the attribute used for cost allocation/chargeback; confirm implementation with SME.
Free-text notes or comments about the asset type.
Most recent sequence number used by the auto-key generator.
Primary utilization meter unit tracked for this type (e.g., miles, hours).
Secondary utilization meter unit, if tracked.
Tertiary utilization meter unit, if tracked.
Threshold at which additional units should be procured; likely used for fleet spares or pooled assets; confirm with SME.
Standard quantity to acquire when the reorder threshold is reached; confirm policy with SME.
Default COF code for this type (likely Cause of Failure on work orders); confirm with SME.
Identifier linking this type to related documents, templates, or attachment groups.
Manufacturerâ€™s estimated service life for the type; confirm time unit with SME.
Indicates whether the type is active and available for use.
Indicates whether this type is considered a vehicle.
Flag indicating inclusion in an SVF program/reporting set; meaning of SVF should be confirmed with SME.
Default GIS geometry used when mapping assets of this type (e.g., point, line).
Largest acceptable increase between consecutive meter readings to validate data and prevent entry errors.
Smallest expected increase between consecutive meter readings to detect rollbacks or resets.
Indicates whether assets of this type participate in motor-pool operations.
Indicates whether assets of this type can be borrowed/shared across users or departments.
Lifecycle threshold for age that signals end-of-life; confirm unit with SME.
Indicates whether age is included in lifecycle/EOL scoring.
Points assigned to the age factor within lifecycle scoring.
Formula or method used to compute the age component of lifecycle scoring; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether inspection/assessment results affect lifecycle scoring.
Points assigned for assessment results within lifecycle scoring.
Calculation method for assessment-based lifecycle points; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether depreciation contributes to lifecycle/EOL scoring.
Points associated with depreciation within lifecycle scoring.
Formula used to translate depreciation into lifecycle points; confirm with SME.
Downtime threshold that qualifies as end-of-life for this type; confirm units with SME.
Indicates whether downtime is included in lifecycle scoring.
Points assigned for downtime within lifecycle scoring.
Method used to calculate downtime-related lifecycle points; confirm with SME.
Maintenance cost threshold that signals end-of-life (e.g., cost vs. replacement); confirm basis with SME.
Indicates whether maintenance cost influences lifecycle scoring.
Points assigned for maintenance cost within lifecycle scoring.
Formula used to convert maintenance cost into lifecycle points; confirm with SME.
Utilization meter threshold (miles/hours) that indicates end-of-life.
Indicates whether utilization meters contribute to lifecycle scoring.
Points assigned for meter-based utilization within lifecycle scoring.
Computation method for meter-based lifecycle points; confirm with SME.
Probability of failure at beginning-of-life used for lifecycle modeling; confirm scale with SME.
Probability of failure at end-of-life used for lifecycle modeling; confirm scale with SME.
Indicates whether probability of failure is included in lifecycle scoring.
Points assigned for probability of failure within lifecycle scoring.
Formula for converting probability of failure into lifecycle points; confirm with SME.
Condition rating at beginning-of-life used in lifecycle modeling; confirm scale with SME.
Condition rating at end-of-life used in lifecycle modeling; confirm scale with SME.
Indicates whether condition rating is used in lifecycle scoring.
Points assigned for condition rating within lifecycle scoring.
Method converting condition ratings into lifecycle points; confirm with SME.
Total lifecycle points threshold at which an asset reaches end-of-life.
Identifier for the default print/report template used for assets of this type.
Indicates whether assets of this type are linear features (e.g., roads, pipelines).
Configuration (often JSON) for how this type is displayed or edited in mobile applications; confirm schema with SME.
Standard unit of measure label associated with this type; confirm usage context with SME.
Code referencing rules for aging or warranty periods; confirm mapping with SME.
Minimum expected fuel efficiency threshold used for performance monitoring and alerts.
Maximum plausible fuel efficiency used to flag data entry or sensor anomalies.
Utilization reading at which assets of this type are considered end-of-life.
End-of-life threshold based on maintenance cost as a percentage of replacement value; confirm basis with SME.
Number of corrective maintenance work orders considered when determining end-of-life.
Number of years of historical data considered in lifecycle calculations and reporting.
